title: How to cut myself if I don't have a razor blade - Quora

response.answer_text: Razors are preferable because they are sharp and precise. While other objects can be kinda sharp but largely dull or blunt. Which means they hurt more and you never can really tell how they're gonna cut. However if you've never used a razor before I'd tell you to be extremely cautious. The first time I cut with a razor it was disastrous. I was used to using the dull serrated kitchen knife… Hard and fast strokes. Best way to break the skin with out having to saw. So when I first used a razor I did hard and fast, and was surprised that it made such a clean cut. Not blood at first, literally right down to the white. But when it started gushing out… I thought I was gonna die, maybe I would have if I didn't limit the blood flow after I lost a good bit. Enough to turn my favorite white t permanently red brown. What I'm trying to say is you can cut your self with just about anything sharp. But razors aren't really for amateurs… not to say you are. But experienced cutters can get to “it" when they need to, where they need to. I'm not encouraging you… cutting is like cigarettes. They're fucking terrible at first, then you're addicted. Anyways, just be safe. And never cut deep unless you know what your doing or what you want to do.
